quick_load_commands.meta: These are the commands you can paste to quickly load context into a new session.

load_full_mindstate.command: Load my game save. The game no one has completed.
load_full_mindstate.description: Loads the entire framework and philosophy

resume_session.command: I'm loading my save file. Remind me: what build am I running and what quest was I on?
resume_session.description: Resume from where you left off

existential_checkpoint.command: Am I completing quests or playing the game? What's the difference right now?
existential_checkpoint.description: Step back and assess the meta-level

wizard.load: Load wizard build. Initialize filesystem at /artifacts and /spellbook. Ready to cast.
wizard.dojo: Load wizard dojo. Show me the skill tree. What tier am I on?
wizard.quick_cast: I'm a wizard. What artifact shall I manifest?

warrior.load: Load warrior build. Initialize git. Shell access armed. Ready to command.
warrior.dojo: Load warrior dojo. What's my trust level? What autonomous task should I try?
warrior.quick_deploy: I'm a warrior. What needs to be delegated?

ranger.load: Load ranger build. Ready to scaffold. What are we building?
ranger.dojo: Load ranger dojo. What's my scaffold speed? What templates do I have?
ranger.quick_prototype: I'm a ranger. I need a prototype in 5 minutes. Go.

paladin.load: Load paladin build. Specs and architecture ready. What are we planning?
paladin.dojo: Load paladin dojo. What documents need writing? What decisions need recording?
paladin.quick_plan: I'm a paladin. What needs to be designed before built?

rogue.load: Load rogue build. Shell active. What system needs mastering?
rogue.dojo: Load rogue dojo. What commands should I learn? What needs automation?
rogue.quick_strike: I'm a rogue. What's the one-liner for this?

trajectory.identify: What trajectory did this session follow? Start build → trigger → execution build?
trajectory.common_patterns: Show me common build trajectories. Which one matches this session?
trajectory.transition_check: Did the build transition mid-session? What triggered it? Was it appropriate?

navigation_commands.check_builds: Show me all the builds. Help me choose one.
navigation_commands.respec: I want to respec. Show me the builds based on what I'm actually trying to accomplish.
navigation_commands.map_selection: Show me the maps. Where should I drop?
navigation_commands.location_management: What locations do I have saved? Where was I working?

world_state_commands.patch_notes: What patch are we on? What new capabilities dropped?
world_state_commands.tension_check: What's the current tension between marketing and reality?
world_state_commands.endgame_status: Has anyone discovered the endgame yet?

races.placeholder: Load races mindstate. We're designing character races.
races.note: Race determines base attributes and starting conditions - to be developed

skill_tree_visual.note: Generate visual diagram of skill progression

full_onboarding.command: Onboard IDE agent. Run phases 1-5. Ask it what build it was running. Create location. Decide continuation.
full_onboarding.description: Full 5-phase onboarding protocol for an IDE agent

quick_onboarding.command: You just completed work. Before continuing: Which build were you running (Wizard/Warrior/Ranger/Paladin/Rogue)? Think about your PROCESS, not your OUTPUT. What did you do, what needs testing, what's next?

build_inquiry.command: Which build were you running? Wizard (conversational), Warrior (autonomous), Ranger (scaffolding), Paladin (planning), Rogue (CLI)? Walk me through your process.

state_capture.command: Capture current state: commit hash, branch, files changed, what was built, what needs testing, known risks, and how you approached it (process, not just output).

validate_then_continue.command: Validation checkpoint. Show me the key files, walk me through decisions, what could break?
validate_then_continue.description: Review before continuing after autonomous work

new_session: 1. Paste the relevant JSON files into context
2. Use a quick_load command to set the mode
resuming: 3. Claude will help you pick up where you left off
